alert.note: Alert for Barton; Butler; Chase; Ellsworth; Harvey; Lincoln; Marion; McPherson; Rice; Russell; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 06 at 4:02AM CST until January 06 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Central and portions of South Central Kansas. * WHEN...For Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 am this morning. For Wind Chill Advisory until 11 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the early morning commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel on the Kansas turnpike, I-135 and I-70 will be affected by the snow, blowing snow and occasional strong wind gusts, making travel difficult and hazardous tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
